taskMan

Class Task

  • java.lang.Object
    • taskMan.Task

  • public class Task
extends java.lang.Object
    The Task object. A task will have an ID, a description, an estimated duration, acceptable deviation and a status. Also it will be possible to set the begin and end time once the project is finished or failed. There is also the extra time that is determined by the alternative.
    Author:
    Tim Van den Broecke, Joran Van de Woestijne, Vincent Van Gestel, Eli Vangrieken

    • Constructor Detail

      • Task

        public Task(int taskID,
    java.lang.String taskDescription,
    int estimatedDuration,
    int acceptableDeviation,
    TimeSpan extraTime)
     throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Create a new Task.
        Parameters:
        taskID - The ID of the new Task.
        taskDescription - The description of the new Task.
        estimatedDuration - The estimated duration of the new Task.
        acceptableDeviation - The acceptable deviation of the new Task.
        extraTime - The extra time offset to add to the elapsed time
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if any of the parameters are invalid ( < 0 or null)

      • Task

    int estimatedDuration,
    int acceptableDeviation,
    java.lang.String taskStatus,
    LocalDateTime beginTime,
    LocalDateTime endTime,
    TimeSpan extraTime)
     throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Create a new Task with start and end time given (only with finished or failed tasks).
        Parameters:
        taskID - The ID of the new Task.
        taskDescription - The description of the new Task.
        estimatedDuration - The estimated duration of the new Task.
        acceptableDeviation - The acceptable deviation of the new Task.
        taskStatus - The status of the new Task.
        beginTime - The begin time of the new Task.
        endTime - The end time of the new Task.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if any of the parameters are invalid ( < 0 or null)

      • getTimeElapsed

        public TimeSpan getTimeElapsed(LocalDateTime currentTime)
                        throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Compares the start time of the project with a given time and calculates the elapsed time in working time.
        Parameters:
        currentTime - The time with which the start time of the task must be compared with.
        Returns:
        time spent on this project in working time
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - When the start time of the task is after the time given.

      • getTimeSpan

        public TimeSpan getTimeSpan()
                     throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Returns the time elapsed since the start of the project and the end of the project.
        Returns:
        time elapsed between the start time and end time
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - whenever the end time is not yet determined
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

      • isOnTime

        public boolean isOnTime()
        Returns whether the current Task in on time.
        Returns:
        True if the Task is on time. False if the elapsed time is longer then the acceptable duration.

      • isUnacceptableOverdue

        public boolean isUnacceptableOverdue()
        Returns whether the current task in unacceptably overdue.
        Returns:
        True if the project is overtime beyond the deviation. False otherwise.
